thread.title: Manchester United: Chris Smalling labelled amateur for this defending | Metro News
thread.title_full: Manchester United: Chris Smalling labelled amateur for this defending | Metro News

author: Evan Bartlett For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Manchester United: Chris Smalling labelled amateur for this defending | Metro News
text:
Evan Bartlett for Metro.co.uk Sunday 19 Feb 2017 6:55 pm Smalling was very slow to react for Danny Graham’s opener (Getty Images) 
Manchester United beat Blackburn Rovers 2-1 on Sunday afternoon to book their place in the FA Cup quarter-final. 
Goals from Marcus Rashford and Zlatan Ibrahimovic helped see off the Championship side who made an early breakthrough thanks to Danny Graham’s goal. 
Graham was put in on goal after a wonderful piece of skill serby Marvin Emnes and finished tidily with his left foot past Sergio Romero. Theo Walcott left red-faced as Arsenal fans slam club for 'disrespectful' gesture 
But it was Chris Smalling’s defending for the goal that came in for particular criticism from United fans. 
The England international was marking Graham but was very slow to react as the ball came through and couldn’t get close to the 31-year-old former Sunderland striker. Manchester United fixtures 
St-Etienne – Europa (A) – Wed 22 Feb Southampton – EFL (N) – Sun 26 Feb Bournemouth (H) – Sat 4 Mar Southampton (A) – Sun 12 Mar Middlesbrough (A) – Sun 19 Mar West Brom (H) – Sat 1 Apr 
United fans took to Twitter to label Smalling ‘slow’, ‘amateur’ and ‘not good enough’. Amateur defending there by Smalling
